Tom, a well-written and informative blog.  When are you going to organise the first official pin swap meeting?  I have plenty of traders, but I'm just waiting to find somebody else to trade them with.

Hi Michael,

Is this for the website or the CMS?

The reason I ask is I cannot see a CMS account with that email address.

If it's the front end have you tried resetting your password, do you not get the email?

Jamie
He means the main website, I think. Unsticky sessions, perhaps?

Hi,

It’s for the website. If I reset the password, I’m not sure where the email will go as I’m not aware of who accesses the ‘support’ email. Are you able to provide me with the correct log in details?

Thanks

Hi Michael,

Do you mean that you try to login to comment and get thrown back to the login form?

This is a known issue, it's actually an issue with the Load Balancer managed by BT (not us) we have a ticket open with BT / ITS about this, I think Morag has one open too.

Jamie

We don't have access to the password as it's encrypted.

Let me see if I can set one for you manually

Jamie

Yep – when I enter the log in and password, which I’ve double checked and am told is definitely correct, it just says failed log in.

Ok thanks very much

Hi Michael

I have manually reset the password for you as it was before.

The username is support@london2012.com

I think the problem was that the wrong password had been entered 10 times, which automatically lock you out (normally people would at this point just request a password reset email but realsie that isn't possible in this case).

I just logged in without issue so hopefully it will work for you too :)

Jamie

Brilliant thanks Jamie, we can now log in properly!

Cheers

Hi,

I've been doing an audit of the French version of the site and have a few issues that I think you may be able to deal with - if any of these aren't for you to fix, then just let me know and we'll sort them with translators.

1. Throughout the French site, the main 2012 logo link takes you back to the English homepage - this should be changed to take you back to the French homepage

2. There is a design issue with the Print/Share/Newsletter links on the bottom of a bunch of pages - as the link text is longer in French than English, the icons often sit underneath the text. For an example see: http://www.london2012.com/fr/games/ and attached screenshot

3. In the attached screenshot, you'll notice that French characters also aren't displaying properly - is this an issue on your end, or a translation issue? This problem also exists on the 'Read more' news link on the French homepage

4. On http://www.london2012.com/fr/games/venues/index.php there are a number of broken mouse-over images

5. Within the Games -> Venues section of the site - the venue Lee Valley White Water Centre is listed under different names in the left hand nav depending on which page you're on - see attached screenshot. The page in question is http://www.london2012.com/fr/games/venues/lee-valley-white-water-centre.php

6. In the same section of the site, there is two links for North Greenwich Arena - the second leading to a missing page. This should be removed from the left hand nav

7. There is a random empty page here: http://www.london2012.com/fr/about-this-website/aide-sur-les-telechargements.php which is appearing in the sidebar of other About this site pages - this should be removed.

Hope that all makes sense - let me know if you have any questions,

Fiona
Marking as high.
Assigning to Lars, but this will probably be a split job. Make sure we track our time on this and look at it next week.

Dear  Sarah,

The countdown is underway, registration for Open Weekend 2011 is now open!

Join us for London 2012 Open Weekend, supported by BP, 22 - 24 July 2011 and celebrate one year to go to the Games.

Now in its fourth year, Open Weekend 2011 will be part of the one year to go celebrations. This year, we want you to celebrate one year to go by showcasing the best art, dance, film, music, heritage and sport in your area as the whole of the UK - and the world - turns its attention to the 2012 Games.

Don't miss this opportunity to demonstrate the talent in your local community and participate in a moment of history.

How to be part of London 2012 Open Weekend
The theme for 2011 is celebrate one year to go by showcasing your best. Taking part is simple, just decide what you want to do and register at www.london2012.com/openweekendhttp://communicate.london2012.com/In/12342917/0/RLozFUbe115M4viA6QcgzhdaSJlFrKFs/.
http://communicate.london2012.com/In/12342918/0/RLozFUbe115M4viA6QcgzhdaSJlFrKFs/
Successful registrations will be given access to the Open Weekend brand centre, helping you promote your event and involvement with London 2012.

Who can be part of London 2012 Open Weekend?
Open Weekend is open to all organisations and venues in the UK; all we ask is that your event:

*  Takes place between 22 - 24 July 2011
*  Is not-for-profit
*  Does not have any commercial sponsorship or offer any similar marketing rights
*  Is open to everyone

More information, including answers to frequently asked questions, are available on the London 2012 web site.
http://communicate.london2012.com/In/12342919/0/RLozFUbe115M4viA6QcgzhdaSJlFrKFs/
Register your event today! We look forward to celebrating with you.

The London 2012 Open Weekend team

P.S. Don't forget applications for London 2012 Olympic tickets opens on Tuesday 15 March. You have until 11.59pm on Tuesday 26 April 2011 to apply.




> Visit www.london2012.com/openweekendhttp://communicate.london2012.com/In/12342920/0/RLozFUbe115M4viA6QcgzhdaSJlFrKFs/ for more information

Dear  Sarah,

The countdown is underway, registration for Open Weekend 2011 is now open!

Join us for London 2012 Open Weekend, supported by BP, 22 - 24 July 2011 and celebrate one year to go to the Games.

Now in its fourth year, Open Weekend 2011 will be part of the one year to go celebrations. This year, we want you to celebrate one year to go by showcasing the best art, dance, film, music, heritage and sport in your area as the whole of the UK - and the world - turns its attention to the 2012 Games.

Don't miss this opportunity to demonstrate the talent in your local community and participate in a moment of history.

How to be part of London 2012 Open Weekend
The theme for 2011 is celebrate one year to go by showcasing your best. Taking part is simple, just decide what you want to do and register at www.london2012.com/openweekendhttp://communicate.london2012.com/In/12342917/0/RLozFUbe115M4viA6QcgzhdaSJlFrKFs/.
http://communicate.london2012.com/In/12342918/0/RLozFUbe115M4viA6QcgzhdaSJlFrKFs/
Successful registrations will be given access to the Open Weekend brand centre, helping you promote your event and involvement with London 2012.

Who can be part of London 2012 Open Weekend?
Open Weekend is open to all organisations and venues in the UK; all we ask is that your event:

*  Takes place between 22 - 24 July 2011
*  Is not-for-profit
*  Does not have any commercial sponsorship or offer any similar marketing rights
*  Is open to everyone

More information, including answers to frequently asked questions, are available on the London 2012 web site.
http://communicate.london2012.com/In/12342919/0/RLozFUbe115M4viA6QcgzhdaSJlFrKFs/
Register your event today! We look forward to celebrating with you.

The London 2012 Open Weekend team

comments.value:
Hi,

I'm having a few issues with the map on the London 2012 website. More specifically, some of the changes I have made to events on the map are causing it to behave strangely and create duplicate events.

For example, as the screenshot below shows, there was an event in October 2010 at the Olympic Park. When this event was initially created in our system, there were errors in the text (eg. 'familly', as below).  I went into this document last week and made a few amendments. I then republished the event, but instead of just updating with my changes, it created a duplicate event. This means that, as the screenshot shows, there are now two articles for this event: one of which is the original version, which still has the spelling error (no. 1 below), and then also my corrected version from last week (no. 2 below).

I'm not really sure how to go about fixing this problem, as there is only one item in CMS which is displaying all of the information correctly. It just seems that instead of my updates overwriting the original, they have created a second version, and the incorrect original doesn't even exist.

Do you have any idea what has caused these problems, or how they can be fixed?

Thanks,

Michael



[cid:image001.png@01CBE7AD.E0636580]






Michael Thorne
Content Coordinator
Editorial Services department
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 046

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0)20 7719 1308
london2012.comhttp://www.london2012.com/

H Michael,

When a page is expired the CMS should automatically poll Stamen with an update, they then make a callback to the CMS and should see that the page no longer exists and so expire it from the map.

I just ran this update process manually (see url at end of email) and it seems to have cleared the duplicate (expired) event.

http://www.london2012.com/map.php

Will keep an eye out to see why it wasn't picked up automatically.

For future reference (do let us know as well) but the url to update on a page (even an expired on) on the map is in this format. 
http://data.map.london2012.com/kitsite-updates.php?path=events/wenlock-at-the-olympic-park-for-the-oda-familly-day.php

Jamie

Brilliant thanks very much

Michael

comments.value: Files apparently making it to FTP server but not getting any further. Urgent, I think.

Hello Liz,
Danny reported a problem with images on the Getty server not making it through to the CMS.
I have investigated the problem and it appears that there are some images that don't have a "CMS Title".
This is s field that gets assigned by Getty, which our feed then reads in order to give the images a title.
The getty feed can be viewed here:
  http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php
None of these images have a CMS Title assigned to them, which is why they're not appearing in the CMS.
I hope this makes sense.
Please let me know if you have any other questions.
Kieran

OK great.  So here is where my problem is - hope you can help.

Attached (CMS) shows the images in CMS with the date 03/03/2011 although if you look at the attached (MM) you can see the created date is 16/03/2011 (in Getty Media Manager) and this date is supposed to send the image to latest photos on our web page and it is not getting there (attachment - latest photo's shows the image is not there).  Currently the picture sent through doesn't appear anywhere on our website.

Thanks,
Justin

We have had a setback in our plans for video on the website. The IOC in their wisdom have instructed that we can't feature any videos including their (sports) footage on our website unless it is hosted on their YouTube channel and embedded in our pages.

This means that we have to be able to accommodate not only our TwoFour player but also a YouTube player in the website. I think this means only the sports pages - which are the main ones likely to have IOC footage in them.

Is it possible to advise how much work will be required to adjust the sports templates to be able to accommodate a YouTube player within the main sports body area? If it is easier just to hardcode them for now we are happy for you to add them manually rather than make this accessible through the CMS. If we could also add them to the searchable Video section that would be good - but I realise this may not be possible and is a nice-to-do rather than a must have.

Re: timings, we'd be looking to have up to six videos in the sports pages / video template by the end of this week if at all possible.... hard coding is fine.

Grateful for your thoughts!
Marking as high.

giggles :)

I though you *couldn't* use YouTube; I won't ask !

The good news is the implementation cost are likely to be modest, with the main cost being us adjusting any HTML/CSS for the player and testing/deployment, we should be able to set a metadata fields and let you paste in a YouTube url.

We'll also need to think of the best way to let you paste in the YouTube url as we don't really want you pasting in the whole block of HTML (or if you do we need to strip out the relevant ID's)

A couple of days work probably, by the time we have tested / deployed, if it's just the Sports template (in fact the Video template could easily be adjusted to fit any size player).

Jamie

Ha ha – I’m glad you can see the funny site. I did not mince my words about the IOC when I heard this ☺

Good re: implementation costs and good if we can also manage this through the CMS.

When do you think it is realistic to do the CMS bit given everything else you have on?

We will have some videos to go in later this week. I will let you know which pages they need to go into, as I’m happy for them to be hardcoded.

Thanks!
